props.title: FSSAI State License – A Comprehensive Guide
props.description: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) is the apex regulatory body responsible for overseeing food safety and hygiene across the country. Any Food Business Operator (FBO) in India is legally required to obtain an FSSAI State License before starting operations, as running a food business without proper registration is a legal offense.

overview.heading: FSSAI State License – An Overview
overview.content: FSSAI enforces the provisions of the Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006 to ensure food businesses maintain strict safety standards.

overview.heading: Role of FSSAI
content: Establishing regulations and guidelines for the food industry
Launching food safety awareness initiatives nationwide
Issuing instructions and compliance requirements for FBOs
Setting standards for food testing laboratories
Collecting and analyzing data on food contaminants
Advising the Government of India on food-related policies and legislation
Operating a rapid alert system to detect and respond to food safety risks promptly

overview.heading: Key Benefits of Obtaining an FSSAI State License

sections.heading: Who Needs an FSSAI State License?
items: Businesses with annual turnover between Rs.12 lakhs and Rs.20 crores (single state)

sections.heading: Documents Required to Obtain FSSAI State License
items: Proof of business premises (owned/rented with NOC)

steps.title: Scrutiny of Application by FSSAI Officials

penalties.amount: Up to Rs.2,00,000 (Rs.25,000 for petty manufacturers)

milestones.title: Preparation & Documentation
milestones.desc: Gather all required paperwork and conduct a preliminary evaluation.

milestones.title: Application Submission
milestones.desc: Submit Form B online or at the FSSAI office.

milestones.title: Document Review
milestones.desc: FSSAI reviews your application; respond to queries.

items.q: What is an FSSAI State License?
items.a: Mandatory authorization by FSSAI to certify compliance with food safety standards.

items.q: How can I obtain an FSSAI State License?
items.a: Submit documents via FoSCoS portal; review and inspection follow.
Food businesses with turnover > Rs.12 lakh, hotels, dairy units, etc.
Yes – fines range Rs.25k to Rs.10 lakh depending on the violation.

items.q: What happens if the license expires?
items.a: You lose legal compliance and must renew to avoid penalties.

items.q: Importance of an FSSAI State License?
items.a: Ensures food safety, builds trust, protects you from legal action.
Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006 (FSS Act).
FSSAI reviews documents, may inspect, then issues license.

items.q: How long does it take to obtain?

items.a: Central for multi-state/high-volume; State for single-state with turnover limits.
